org.easybatch.xml

Class XmlRecordMapper<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.easybatch.xml.XmlRecordMapper<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the target domain object type
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    RecordMapper<T>

    public class XmlRecordMapper<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements RecordMapper<T>
    A record mapper that maps xml records to domain objects annotated with JaxB2 annotations.
    Author:
    Mahmoud Ben Hassine (mahmoud@benhassine.fr)

      Creates an XmlRecordMapper.
      XmlRecordMapper(javax.xml.bind.Unmarshaller unmarshaller)
      Creates a XmlRecordMapper with a pre-configured Unmarshaller (with custom adapter, custom listener, etc).

    • Constructor Detail

      • XmlRecordMapper

        public XmlRecordMapper(java.lang.Class<? extends T> type)
                throws javax.xml.bind.JAXBException
        Creates an XmlRecordMapper. Using this constructor, no validation against an xsd will be applied.
        Parameters:
        type - the target domain object type.
        Throws:
        javax.xml.bind.JAXBException - thrown if an error occurs during the creation of Jaxb context.

      • XmlRecordMapper

        public XmlRecordMapper(java.lang.Class<? extends T> type,
               java.io.File xsd)
                throws javax.xml.bind.JAXBException,
                       org.xml.sax.SAXException
        Creates an XmlRecordMapper.
        Parameters:
        type - the target domain object type.
        xsd - the xsd file against which xml records will be validated
        Throws:
        javax.xml.bind.JAXBException - thrown if an error occurs during the creation of Jaxb context.
        org.xml.sax.SAXException - thrown if an error occurs during the schema parsing.

      • XmlRecordMapper

        public XmlRecordMapper(javax.xml.bind.Unmarshaller unmarshaller)
        Creates a XmlRecordMapper with a pre-configured Unmarshaller (with custom adapter, custom listener, etc).
        Parameters:
        unmarshaller - the unmarshaller to use
